candidates.title: refactor(crypto): Remove the dead pickle key
Preparing all the small things for release
candidates.body:
This PR contains all the works to make our crates ready for publishing to crates.io:

- [x] clean up `Cargo.toml` required Metadata, (e.g. `license`, `repository`)
- [x] set readme files for new crates
- [x] fix test-macros error
- [x] bump-versions where necessary
- [x] ensure everything builds (thanks to `cargo unleash`)

candidates.title: Align crate names
candidates.body:
Rename:
 - matrix-qrcode -> matrix-sdk-qrcode
 - matrix-crypto-ffi -> matrix-sdk-crypto-ffi

candidates.title: More redaction improvements
candidates.body: Part of #607.

candidates.title: [Breaking Change] Use boxed errors in StoreError
candidates.body:
Downstream applications may wish to implement their own StateStore/CryptoStore and may not use anyhow.

This commit switches the Database backend error from `anyhow::Error` to `Box<Error>`, which is more compatible with other rust error libraries.

### Migration Guide
If you are using anyhow or eyre, you need to map the error like this:

```rust
expr.map_err(|e| StoreError::Backend(e.into())
```

If your error types implement std::error::Error, you need to map the error like this:

```rust
expr.map_err(|e| StoreError::Backend(Box::new(e)))
```

Special thanks to @jplatte for the idea.

Replaces/Closes #643

candidates.title: Use OnceCell to store server versions
candidates.body:
Since the server versions isn't modified we can use a OnceCell and
get rid of the Mutex.

candidates.title: fix(sled): Fix the compilation if only the cryptostore is enabled
candidates.body:
`make_store_config()` is enabled for both of the features we have in the sled crate, but `StoreConfig` was only imported if the `state-store` feature was enabled.

We're also building the `crypto-ffi` crate separately in the`xtask ci` target, which uses the sled store with the `crypto-store` feature, which makes sure we don't regress. Not sure if we want to add a separate `sled` target to `xtask`.

candidates.title: Put timeline behind a feature-flag
candidates.body:
Feature-gated with `experimental-timeline` for base, sled, indexeddb and the main SDK-crates.

Note: this has to use weak dependencies in order to allow proper switching it on from the main crate.

candidates.title: Make matrix-sdk-common smaller
candidates.body:
I'm not a fan of common-dependency re-export crates, they're not very good at solving the problems they intend to solve. We haven't been maintaining this consistently anyways, so I think it's time to start removing things from it.

Ultimately, I would like to get rid of the `-common` crate entirely, but that's not realistic right now.

2. xshell - Requires code changes
3. image - Blocked on [qrcode-rust](https://github.com/kennytm/qrcode-rust)
4. rqrr - Same as image

candidates.title: Weak feature dependencies
candidates.body:
This PR:
 - [x] switches to latest rust 1.60 as MSRV
 - [x] renames `encryption`-feature to `e2e-encryption` for clarity
 - [x] combines the `*-state-store`/`*-crypto-store` features into a single feature `sled` and `indexeddb` respectivly
 - [x] and combines them with weak `e2e-encryption`-dependencies to activate the features as necessary
 - [x] moves the code back to the sled-store, where it belongs
 - [x] updates the docs accordingly

fixes #562

candidates.title: replace lazy_static with once_cell
candidates.body:
fix #576 

Signed-off-by: cutecutecat <starkind1997@gmail.com>

candidates.title: Remove store_key
candidates.body:
- [x] replace store-key in state store with new crypto cipher
   - [x] in sled store
   - [x] in indexeddbstore
- [x] remove store-key from base-crate, including all feature references
- [x] add tests for encrypted store
  - [x] in sled store
  - [x] in indexeddbstore 
- [x] add key encryption to state store
   - [x] in sled store
   - [x] in indexeddbstore

Also improves some tests in the integration tests to be more expressive on errors.

_Notes_: this now uses the base64-crate to encode the `Vec<u8>` from the `hash_key` for the indexeddb store. It also encodes the usize as zero-leading-hex-value for the timeline, which might needs some adjusting if that is not sufficient. 

_Note 2_ on the cipher: Had to expose both the internal Encrypted type and the inner functions for indexeddb optimisations. All documented though.

candidates.title: Upgrade Ruma
candidates.body: This includes *some* fixes to properly take redacted events into account where they weren't before, but the remaining code locations that match on `SomeEventKind::Original` should be reviewed at some point.

candidates.title: Fix the WASM example

candidates.title: Remove some unwraps when creating inbound sessions
Upgrade Ruma
candidates.body:
Since we agreed to get Ruma 0.6.0 out before the next SDK release, we can bump versions more frequently again. This PR had me discover a bunch of small issues in Ruma, which have all been fixed along the way.

Depends on

* https://github.com/ruma/ruma/pull/1021
* https://github.com/ruma/ruma/issues/1024

candidates.title: feat(store-key): Add a dedicated store key crate
Change store initialization
candidates.body:
context: https://matrix.to/#/!iYnZafYUoXkeVPOSQh:matrix.org/$yh6vVuOVhR_RWgdtHY6_HiFBgv_R-46TK-E-B3HwQlw?via=matrix.org&via=kde.org&via=one.ems.host

The main goal of this work is to remove the default magic that happens to create the stores and have something more explicit.

I ended up creating a mix of what was discussed as it made more sense to me looking at how the code is organized. By default I could have reused `BaseClientConfig` but it doesn't make sense to expose it in the main crate as the `BaseClient` doesn't mean anything there, so I created `StoreConfig`.

By default a `MemoryStore` is always used now. The stores have to be explicitely opened and provided to the `ClientConfig`. There are two helper functions to do that in the store crates `open_stores_with_*` and `make_config`.

candidates.title: feat: Import the Uniffi based matrix-sdk-crypto bindings
candidates.body:
This imports the bindings of the crypto crate from https://github.com/vector-im/element-android/pull/3209/ into the repo.

The CI hasn't been yet hooked up, the idea is to eventually let CI build the bindings as well. @ganfra intends to work on the Element Android packaging setup and the CI setup to do this.
